00145 /* Debugging Macros.
00146 // George F. Riley, Georgia Tech, Summer 2000
00147 
00148 // Debug is enabled with a bitmask, DEBUG_MASK
00149 // Define DEBUG_MASK prior to calling debug.h
00150 // If bit 0 is set, level 0 debugs are enabled.
00151 // up to level 31.
00152 //
00153 // To completely remove all debug (more efficient)
00154 // define NO_DEBUG prior to calling.
00155 */
00156 
00157 #ifndef __DEBUG_H__
00158 #define __DEBUG_H__
00159 
00160 // Some qt includes define a DEBUG macro different from this one
00161 #ifdef DEBUG
00162 #undef DEBUG
00163 #endif
00164 
00165 #ifdef NO_DEBUG
00166 #define DBG(x)
00167 #define DEBUG(l,x)
00168 #define DEBUG0(x)
00169 #else
00170 #ifndef DEBUG_MASK
00171 #define DEBUG_MASK 0
00172 #endif
00173 
00174 #define DBM DEBUG_MASK
00175 
00176 #define DBG(x) x
00177 #define DEBUG(l,x) if((1<<l)&DBM) x
00178 #define DEBUG0(x)if(1&DBM) x
00179 
00180 #endif
00181 
00182 #endif
00183
